data.question: What is the main goal of purifying C2H2 from gas mixtures containing CO2?
data.answer: The main goal is to remove CO2 impurities from C2H2-containing gas mixtures, which is important for purifying C2H2, a feedstock chemical used in the production of several commodity chemicals.

data.question: Why is the separation of C2H2 and CO2 by physisorption considered extremely difficult?
data.answer: The separation is considered extremely difficult because C2H2 and CO2 exhibit similar size and physicochemical properties.

data.question: What makes SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i exceptional for CO2/C2H2 and C2H2/CO2 selectivity, respectively?
data.answer: SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i exhibit exceptional CO2/C2H2 and C2H2/CO2 selectivity, respectively, due to their distinct sorbate binding sites.

data.question: True or False: SIFSIX-3-Ni sets a benchmark for CO2/C2H2 selectivity at low partial pressures.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of the distinct sorbate binding sites in SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
data.answer: The distinct sorbate binding sites in SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i are attributed to their exceptional selectivity for CO2/C2H2 and C2H2/CO2, respectively.

data.question: True or False: TIFSIX-2-Cu-i ranks among the best porous materials for C2H2/CO2 selectivity.
data.answer: True

data.question: How was the performance of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i confirmed?
data.answer: The performance of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i was confirmed by real-time dynamic breakthrough experiments.

data.question: True or False: The yin-yang inversion of selectivity in closely related compounds like SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i is common.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the yin-yang inversion of selectivity observed in SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
data.answer: The yin-yang inversion of selectivity observed in SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i is unprecedented and highlights the critical role of binding sites in determining sorbent-sorbate energies and selectivities.

data.question: True or False: SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i have similar pore size and pore chemistry.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the main challenge in the physisorptive separation process involving pure C2H2?
data.answer: The main challenge is the strict upper pressure limits for processes involving pure C2H2 (2 bar) and the very similar physicochemical properties of C2H2 and CO2.

data.question: True or False: Most physisorbents interact more strongly with CO2 than with C2H2.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of molecular simulations in the study of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
data.answer: Molecular simulations provide insight into the very different binding sites for CO2 and C2H2 in SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i, supporting their exceptional selectivity.

data.question: True or False: The performance of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i in dynamic gas breakthrough experiments was inconsistent with their single-component gas sorption behavior.
data.answer: False

data.question: What makes the yin-yang inversion of selectivity between SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i unprecedented?
data.answer: The yin-yang inversion of selectivity between SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i is unprecedented because it highlights the critical role of binding sites in determining sorbent-sorbate energies and selectivities in otherwise closely related materials.

data.question: True or False: The structural integrity of TIFSIX-2-Cu-i is unaffected by humidity.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the accelerated aging protocol in the study of TIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
data.answer: The accelerated aging protocol is significant as it demonstrates that the structural integrity and sorption performance of TIFSIX-2-Cu-i are unaffected by humidity, which is important for industrial applications.

data.question: True or False: The yin-yang inversion of selectivity in SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i suggests that even subtle structural changes can profoundly affect gas sorption performance.
data.answer: True

data.question: How does the yin-yang inversion of selectivity impact the potential industrial applications of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i?
data.answer: The yin-yang inversion of selectivity impacts the potential industrial applications of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i by demonstrating their ability to selectively separate C2H2 from CO2 and vice versa, which could lead to more energy-efficient and environmentally friendly purification processes.

data.question: True or False: The study of SIFSIX-3-Ni and TIFSIX-2-Cu-i provides insight that could drive the design of the next generation of physisorbents.
data.answer: True
